de.feig.TagHandler
Class FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2

java.lang.Object
  de.feig.TagHandler.FedmIscTagHandler
      de.feig.TagHandler.FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2
Direct Known Subclasses:
FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2_IDS_SL900A, FedmIscTagHandler_ISO18000_3M3
public class FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2
extends FedmIscTagHandler

Class for HF/UHF transponder EPC Class 1 Generation 2.
This class supports only addressed or non-addressed mode in Host-Mode
.

Description:
TID extracted from UID
returns "", if TID is not part of UID

getTagModelNumber

public int getTagModelNumber()
Method to query the Tag Model Number

Returns:
Tag Model Number

Description:
The Tag Model Number is part of the TID and can only be returned, if the TID is part of the UID or if the first 2 blocks of the TID memory is read separately.
The EPC Class 1 Gen 2 standard reserves the bits 14h .. 1Fh of the TID memory as a vendor-defined 12-bit Tag Model Number.

getMaskDesignerID

public int getMaskDesignerID()
Method to query the Mask Designer Identifier

Returns:
Mask Designer Identifier

Description:
The Mask Designer Identifier is part of the TID and can only be returned, if the TID is part of the UID or if the first 2 blocks of the TID memory is read separately.
The EPC Class 1 Gen 2 standard reserves the bits 08h .. 13h of the TID memory as a 12-bit Mask Designer Identifier (obtainable from the registration authority).

getMaskDesignerName

public java.lang.String getMaskDesignerName()
Method to query the Manufacturer Name

Returns:
Manufacturer Name

Description:
The Manufacturer Name is specified by the Mask Designer Identifier, which is part of the TID.
The Manufacturer name can only be returned, if the TID is part of the UID or if the first 2 blocks of the TID memory is read separately.
The EPC Class 1 Gen 2 standard reserves the bits 08h .. 13h of the TID memory as a 12-bit Mask Designer Identifier (obtainable from the registration authority).

readCompleteBank

public int readCompleteBank(int bank,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            FedmIscTagHandler_Result result)
                     throws FePortDriverException,
                            FeReaderDriverException,
                            FedmException
Read complete bank of transponder

Parameters:
bank - bank number
password - access password
result - FedmIscTagHandler_Result object containing return values
Returns:
operation status

Description:
Extended [0xB0][0x23] Read Multiple Blocks command

The return value indicates the success:
0 - tramsmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong
The result object of type FedmIscTagHandler_Result contains only valid data (result.blockSize and result.data), if the operation status is 0.

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem

The result object of type FedmIscTagHandler_Result contains only valid data (result.blockSize and result.data), if the operation status is 0.

writeMultipleBlocks

public int writeMultipleBlocks(int bank,
                               int firstDataBlock,
                               int noOfDataBlocks,
                               java.lang.String password,
                               byte[] data)
                        throws FePortDriverException,
                               FeReaderDriverException,
                               FedmException
Write of transponder data

Parameters:
bank - bank number
firstDataBlock - first data block address
noOfDataBlocks - number of requested data blocks
password - access password
data - byte array with transponder data to be written to
Returns:
operation status

Description:
Basic [0xB0][0x24] Write Multiple Blocks command

The return value indicates the success:
0 - tramsmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong

If the return status is 0x03, the errorDBAddress is set.

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

                    java.lang.String password)

                    FeReaderDriverException,
                    FedmException
Write of EPC to transponder

Parameters:
newEPC - EPC to be written to
password - access password
Returns:
operation status

Description:
Special [0xB0][0x24] Write Multiple Blocks command to write a new EPC number to the EPC bank of a transponder

The return value indicates the success:
0 - tramsmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

password - access password

0 - tramsmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem

lock

public int lock(java.lang.String password,
                byte lockKill,
                byte lockAccess,
                byte lockEPC,
                byte lockTID,
                byte lockUser)
         throws FePortDriverException,
                FeReaderDriverException,
                FedmException
Lock command (simplified method - recommended to use)

Parameters:
password - access password
lockKill - lock settings for kill
lockAccess - lock settings for access pasword
lockEPC - lock settings for EPC memory
lockTID - lock settings for TID memory
lockUser - lock settings for User memory
Returns:
operation status

Description:
[0xB3][0x22] Lock command to secure the access to a transponder

One of the constants UNCHANGED, UNLOCK, UNLOCK_PERMANENTLY, LOCK or LOCK_PERMANENTLY can be used to define the lock settings.
The return value indicates the success:
0 - transmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

lock

public int lock(java.lang.String password,
                byte killMask,
                byte killAction,
                byte accessMask,
                byte accessAction,
                byte epcMask,
                byte epcAction,
                byte tidMask,
                byte tidAction,
                byte userMask,
                byte userAction)
         throws FePortDriverException,
                FeReaderDriverException,
                FedmException
Lock command (Method interface according the specification)

Parameters:
password - access password
killMask - 2 Bit mask settings for kill
killAction - 2 Bit action settings for kill
accessMask - 2 Bit mask settings for access pasword
accessAction - 2 Bit action settings for access pasword
epcMask - 2 Bit mask settings for EPC memory
epcAction - 2 Bit action settings for EPC memory
tidMask - 2 Bit mask settings for TID memory
tidAction - 2 Bit action settings for TID memory
userMask - 2 Bit mask settings for User memory
userAction - 2 Bit action settings for User memory
Returns:
operation status

Description:
[0xB3][0x22] Lock command to secure the access to a transponder

The return value indicates the success:
0 - tramsmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

blockPermalock

public int blockPermalock(int bank,
                          int blockPointer,
                          int blockRange,
                          java.lang.String password,
                          byte[] mask)
                   throws FePortDriverException,
                          FeReaderDriverException,
                          FedmException
Set blocks to permalock command

Parameters:
bank - bank number
blockPointer - first block (consider: vendor specific block size)
blockRange - number of blocks (limited to 4)
password - optional access password
mask - buffer with mask
Returns:
operation status

Description:
[0xB3][0x25] Block Permalock command to secure the memory of a transponder
Note: This is an optional command according EPC Class1 Gen2 spec and not supported by all tags

The return value indicates the success:
0 - transmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

readPermalockStatus

public int readPermalockStatus(int bank,
                               int blockPointer,
                               int blockRange,
                               java.lang.String password,
                               FedmIscTagHandler_Result result)
                        throws FePortDriverException,
                               FeReaderDriverException,
                               FedmException
Read blocks permalock status command

Parameters:
bank - bank number
blockPointer - first block (consider: vendor specific block size)
blockRange - number of blocks (limited to 4)
password - optional access password
result - FedmIscTagHandler_Result object containing return values
Returns:
operation status

Description:
[0xB3][0x25] Block Permalock command to secure the memory of a transponder
Note: This is an optional command according EPC Class1 Gen2 spec and not supported by all tags

The return value indicates the success:
0 - transmission was successful
status byte (>1), if the reader signals a problem
error code (<0), if something goes wrong
The result object of type FedmIscTagHandler_Result contains only the returned mask (in result.data), if the operation status is 0.

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException
